marketNews.title: Bank Mandiri 1H25: Net Profit -8% YoY, Below Expectations
marketNews.content: Bank Mandiri reported a net profit of 11.3 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (-19% YoY, -15% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 24.5 trillion rupiah (-8% YoY), below expectations as it equals 44% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 1H24: 48% realization for 2024). This relatively weak net profit performance was mainly caused by a surge in opex. Following the release of the 1H25 performance, BMRI also made adjustments to several 2025 guidance figures.

marketNews.title: Opex Surge Pressures Net Profit
marketNews.content: BMRI booked an opex increase of +35% YoY/+25% YoY in 2Q25/1H25, which was primarily caused by a one-off adjustment from the company's financial statement audit. Although not detailing the exact reason for the increased opex after the audit, BMRI management stated that the size of the adjustment ranges from 10-12% of the estimated 2025F opex. The majority of the adjustment was booked in June 2025, with the remainder to be booked in the coming months. Overall, BMRI management expects that opex for 2025F will grow roughly the same as the growth in 1H25 (+25% YoY). For 2026, BMRI management expects opex to be relatively flat compared to 2025 in the base-case scenario, or to increase by a low-single digit in the bear-case scenario. Aside from opex, key operational metrics were relatively good with Net Interest Income growing +8% YoY/+7% YoY in 2Q25/1H25, while provision expenses only slightly increased by +2% YoY/+5%% YoY.

marketNews.title: Liquidity Injection and 2025 Guidance Adjustments
marketNews.content: BMRI management revised down the 2025 guidance (see table above) for credit growth and Net Interest Margin (NIM). Meanwhile, Cost of Credit (CoC) is expected to be better than previous guidance along with asset quality - NPL and LAR - which are maintained. The reduction in credit growth and NIM guidance already accounts for the impact of a 55 trillion rupiah liquidity injection from the government and the expectation that the BI Rate will still be cut by another 50 bps until the end of 2025. According to BMRI management, further clarity is still needed from the government regarding the rules/policies for using these funds - such as the scope of the real sector definition and permitted products - for both assets and liabilities.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Based on the overall guidance revisions provided, we see that BMRI will still tend to be conservative and choose to wait and see first. We assess that the acceleration of government spending is what is awaited to start boosting demand, so that the banking sector in general - not just BMRI - will be more confident to increase the pace of credit disbursement. The risk potential we see is if the government mandates a reduction in credit interest rates to help stimulate demand, which could impact banking profitability.

marketNews.title: Other hot updates you need to know...
marketNews.content: The DPR Legislation Body approved 67 Bills to be included in the priority national legislative program (prolegnas) agenda for deliberation in 2026 on Thursday (18/9). One of the laws to be reviewed is the State Finance Law, which regulates the maximum budget deficit limit of 3% of GDP and the maximum total debt limit of 60% of GDP. Meanwhile, the Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, stated that he does not see the need to change the current budget deficit and debt ratio limits. Reuters reported that 12 economists expect Bank Indonesia to cut interest rates more aggressively following the surprise BI Rate cut on Wednesday (17/9), with a median forecast for the BI Rate to be at 4% in 2026. For context, the consensus from 21 economists surveyed by Reuters before the Bank Indonesia announcement expected the BI Rate to be at 4.5% in 2026. IDX Channel reported that the Minister of Finance, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, on Friday (19/9) promised to pay more attention to the tobacco industry, while emphasizing that overly aggressive tobacco excise taxes are an irresponsible policy. Purbaya also highlighted the prevalence of illegal cigarettes and will order his staff to monitor and eradicate the sale of illegal cigarettes, including those sold online. President Prabowo Subianto appointed the Deputy Minister of State-Owned Enterprises and COO of Danantara, Dony Oskaria, as the acting (Plt) Minister of State-Owned Enterprises. Dony's appointment follows Erick Thohir's position change to Minister of Youth and Sports. The National Nutrition Agency reported on Thursday (18/9) that the realization of budget absorption for the Free Nutritious Meal (MBG) program has only reached approximately 8.3 trillion rupiah, with the BGN budget realization target reaching 10 trillion rupiah in October 2025. For context, the budget allocation for the MBG program in 2025 reached 171 trillion rupiah, while the budget allocation for 2026 reaches 335 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea (PTRO) Plans to Acquire Scan-Bilt Pte. Ltd.
tickerNews.content: Petrosea announced it has signed a non-binding term sheet to acquire majority shares in Scan-Bilt Pte. Ltd. (SBPL), a Singaporean company engaged in plant civil engineering construction and maintenance work for the onshore chemical and oil & gas industries. The acquisition agreement will proceed to the due diligence and further negotiation stages. PTRO President Director, Michael, stated that this acquisition plan is part of the company's growth and diversification strategy into the chemical and energy sectors. SBPL handles several maintenance contracts for Aster Chemicals and Energy, a joint venture owned by Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) and Glencore.

tickerNews.title: Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS) 2Q25 Results
tickerNews.content: Bank Syariah Indonesia recorded a net profit of 1.9 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (+10% YoY, -1% QoQ). This result made the net profit for 1H25 reach 3.7 trillion rupiah (+10% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 47% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 1H24: 48% realization for the year). Net profit growth was driven by a Net Margin Income increase of +24% YoY/+15% YoY in 2Q25/1H25. Net Remuneration also rose to 5.7% level during 1H25 (vs. 1Q25: 5.3%, 1H24: 5.5%), consistent with the management's 2025 guidance in the range of 5.5-5.9%. However, operational expenses swelled +23% YoY/+20% YoY in 2Q25/1H25, causing PPOP growth to be lower compared to the Net Margin Income growth at +13% YoY/+12% YoY. Meanwhile, the slowdown in Third Party Fund growth as of June 2025 (+9% YoY, vs. 2024: +11% YoY) was more significant than the slowdown in financing growth (+14% YoY, vs. 2024: +16% YoY), causing the Financing-to-Deposit Ratio to increase to 91% (vs. 2024: 85%), the highest level recorded since at least 2020.

tickerNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu and BRPT Board Receive Additional Shares via MESOP
tickerNews.content: The Controller and Commissioner of Barito Pacific, Prajogo Pangestu, received an additional ~1.5 million BRPT shares from the MESOP program on September 15, 2025. Following this transaction, Prajogo Pangestu's direct ownership portion in BRPT did not change significantly and is still around 71.36%. Besides Prajogo Pangestu, BRPT board members and commissioners - namely, Lim Chong Thian, Agus Salim Pangestu, Rudy Suparman, Diana Arsiyanti, and David Kosasih - each received ~928 thousand, ~1.5 million, ~1 million, ~1.1 million, and ~1.2 million BRPT shares from the MESOP program on September 15, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bumi Resources' Bond Issuance for Acquisition and Working Capital
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources plans to issue bonds worth 721.6 billion rupiah, where the proceeds are intended for the payment of the 2nd stage of the total planned acquisition value of Wolfram Limited, providing loans to Wolfram Limited for capital expenditure and working capital, and the company's working capital. The bonds, which have received an idA+ rating from Pefindo, consist of a 3-year tenor (8% interest) and a 5-year tenor (9.25% interest).

tickerNews.title: Semen Indonesia (SMGR) August 2025 Sales Volume Update
tickerNews.content: Semen Indonesia recorded a positive cement sales volume growth of +2.4% YoY in August 2025, although for 8M25 it was still down -2.7% YoY (vs. 8M24: -3.4% YoY). SMGR's domestic sales volume during 8M25 fell -6.8% YoY, deeper than the decline in industry-wide volume (-3.3% YoY), causing SMGR's market share to decline year-on-year to 47.9% in 8M25 (vs. 8M24: 49.7%, 1H25: 47.6%). Based on segmentation, the sales volume for bagged cement and bulk cement decreased by -3.7% YoY and -14% YoY, respectively, during 8M25.
